Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Application of state protection test and procedural fairness
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credibility concerns did not necessitate an oral hearing
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Country condition evidence on St. Lucia, homophobia risks, domestic abuse
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Inadequate state protection due to domestic abuse and homophobia in St. Lucia
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Focus on government efforts rather than tangible results in state protection
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to assess state protection based on outcomes
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Contradictory evidence regarding homophobia and state response in St. Lucia
Crimes.Legal_Standard: State protection must be effective in practice, not just in policy
Crimes.Application_Factor: Perceived risk due to sexual orientation and gender-based violence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision found unreasonable, case remitted for re-determination
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB) / Immigration Officer

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Correct application of state protection test and procedural fairness
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credibility was not central; no oral hearing required
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Evidence on country conditions in St. Lucia, homophobia, domestic violence
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk upon return due to inadequate state protection in St. Lucia
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Overemphasis on governmental efforts over actual protection outcomes
Crimes.Application_Error: Incorrect focus on state efforts instead of protection effectiveness
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of decision under administrative law
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Contradictory reports on LGBTQ+ safety and domestic violence enforcement
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tangible results required for adequate state protection
Crimes.Application_Factor: Fear of persecution based on sexual orientation and gender
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for re-determination

Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 116 of Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant remained in Canada after expiration of authorized stay
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant or person with pending protection claim
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – regulatory breach, not fraud
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Assessment during PRRA without procedural unfairness found
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of immigration officer to assess risk despite status violation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Country condition reports, personal testimony, NGO reports
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient consideration of updated country conditions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credibility not central to the decision
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA decision overturned due to unreasonable state protection analysis
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal, reassessment of risk upon return
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Re-determination by a new immigration officer
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Officer failed to base state protection on actual outcomes

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Adequacy of state protection and procedural fairness in PRRA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Minor credibility concerns, did not require oral hearing
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Country reports, applicant’s testimony, evidence on homophobia in St. Lucia
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA (risk assessment upon return)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk due to sexual orientation and domestic violence in St. Lucia
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: State protection must be effective in practice, not merely existent
Crimes.Application_Error: Reliance on state efforts rather than protection outcomes
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Reports indicating lack of enforcement against homophobic violence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Real chance of harm if returned, insufficient state protection
Crimes.Application_Factor: Bisexuality and history of domestic abuse as risk factors

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of PRRA refusal
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Oral hearing not required; minor credibility issues
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Evidence considered but misinterpreted regarding state protection
Crimes.Criminal_Activity: Drug trafficking offense leading to deportation risk
Crimes.Mode_of_Entry: Previous entry via UK, deported, now seeking protection in Canada
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Risk upon return linked to personal vulnerabilities, not crime
Crimes.Evidence_Source: UNHCR reports, human rights organizations, personal affidavit
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Unreasonable assessment of state protection despite criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms, CAT obligations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Breach: None found; decision flawed on substantive grounds

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of PRRA decision
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: No breach; credibility not central to decision
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: All relevant evidence considered but misapplied
Crimes.Criminal_Activity: Drug smuggling resulting in UK deportation
Crimes.Mode_of_Entry: Entered Canada after deportation from UK
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Criminal inadmissibility due to serious offense
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Personal risk due to bisexuality and domestic abuse, not related to crime
Crimes.Evidence_Source: NGO reports, ILRU, UNHCR, personal narrative
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Unreasonable conclusion on state protection despite criminal history

Violation_Type: Failure to adequately assess state protection
Legal_Provision_Violated: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Applicants feared persecution by the principal applicant's former husband, a police officer in Mexico; claimed domestic violence and corruption as grounds for refugee protection
Procedural_Issue: Board failed to properly analyze contradictory evidence regarding Mexico's ability to provide protection
Evidence_Used: Mexico's democratic status, evidence of ineffective protection measures
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board ignored contradictory evidence on state protection effectiveness
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision found to be erroneous
Relief_Sought: Recognition of refugee status based on fear of domestic violence and corruption
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review and re-determination of refugee claim
Legal_Standard_Applied: Presumption of state protection in democratic countries under subsection 72(1), rebuttable by clear evidence
Decision_Rationale: The Board erred by relying solely on Mexico's democratic status without addressing evidence of systemic failures in protection against domestic violence and corruption

Credibility_Assessment: Supported by consistent reporting and corroborative circumstances
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

Violation_Type: Failure to provide adequate state protection assessment
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 101(1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Application_Facts: Applicant fled Saint Lucia due to domestic abuse and sought asylum in Canada; challenged negative PRRA decision based on inadequate state protection assessment
Residency_Compliance: Compliant with Canadian immigration procedures at time of application
Procedural_Issue: PRRA Officer treated failure to seek state protection as fatal, relied on non-police agencies for protection, failed to properly consider country condition evidence
Evidence_Used: Country condition reports on Saint Lucia, applicant's testimony on domestic abuse
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer disregarded relevant country condition evidence
Outcome: Judicial review granted; decision found unreasonable
Relief_Sought: Stay of removal, reevaluation of PRRA
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration of PRRA by a different officer
Decision_Rationale: Officer's conclusion was not justified, transparent, or intelligible; fell outside acceptable range of outcomes due to errors in assessing state protection
Authority_Responsible: PRRA Officer, Federal Court (on judicial review)

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Risk of persecution upon removal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in assessing the applicant's risk of torture, death, or cruel treatment if returned to Pakistan
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer found insufficient evidence linking applicant's MQM-A membership to specific risks; claims were vague and lacked detail
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate personalized risk
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Lack of credible, detailed evidence about threats or political involvement
Crimes.Legal_Rule: A person in need of protection must face a personal risk not shared by others in their country under IRPA s.97
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of torture, death, or cruel treatment upon return to Pakistan due to MQM-A affiliation
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's membership in MQM-A, alleged attack by MQM-H, resulting paraplegia, lack of documentation on direct threats
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Officer concluded no sufficient link between applicant’s activities and personal risk
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Self-reported political involvement, medical records (paraplegia), lack of third-party verification
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal based on risk of harm
Crimes.Authority: Immigration officer, reviewed by Federal Court

Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed risk due to MQM-A membership and threats from MQM-H
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Lawful presence challenged due to inadmissibility
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – focus on credibility and evidence sufficiency
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether officer followed fair process in evaluating risk claims
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over judicial review of PRRA decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Applicant's statements on political involvement and attack
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of objective evidence linking membership to personal risk
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims deemed vague and unsubstantiated
Crimes.Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; removal not deferred
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Recognition as person in need of protection
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Insufficient evidence to establish a personal risk distinct from general population
Crimes.Authority_Responsible: Immigration officer, subject to judicial review

Crimes.Crime_Name: Membership in an organization engaged in terrorism
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Alleged membership in MQM-A, listed as terrorist entity
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Officer assessed whether applicant posed threat or was at risk due to involvement
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Affiliation with politically active group involved in violence
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Political activism, alleged attack leading to paraplegia
Crimes.Target_Entity: Applicant allegedly targeted by rival faction (MQM-H)
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Applicant admitted MQM-A membership but denied militant role
Crimes.Leadership_Role: No evidence of leadership role provided
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Officer found applicant's account lacking in detail and corroboration
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Failure to prove attacker identity or political motivation of attack
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Self-declarations, medical report, absence of police or witness records
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Generalized claims without specific supporting evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Vague descriptions of involvement and threats
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility due to alleged terrorist affiliation
Crimes.Consequences_of_Action: Inadmissibility finding, rejection of protection claim, eligibility for removal

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to provide sufficient evidence for refugee protection
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Eligibility for protection under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant failed to provide sufficient evidence to qualify as a person in need of protection
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Limited evidence on MQM-A role and threats; documentary country conditions not personally linked
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show personal risk upon return
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Lack of specific details about political activities or direct threats
Crimes.Legal_Rule: A person faces a need for protection if removal would result in torture, risk to life, or cruel treatment personally
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion and membership in particular social group
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Medical record of paraplegia, self-reported political affiliation, lack of corroborative evidence
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Officer found no credible link between the attack and political activities
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, medical documentation, lack of official reports
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Recognition as person in need of protection
Crimes.Outcome: Removal not stayed; proceedings allowed to continue
Crimes.Authority: Immigration officer, reviewed by Federal Court

Crimes.Violation_Type: Immigration violation due to failure to depart after visa expiration
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant is a U.S. citizen who remained in Canada beyond the authorized period and has prior U.S. convictions
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to comply with departure notice
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of adjudicator's decision on equivalency and stay of deportation
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Canadian immigration authorities to enforce deportation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Adjudicator's determination, applicant’s criminal record, Black's Law Dictionary
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of deportation dismissed
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of deportation based on irreparable harm and balance of convenience
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Requirement to prove irreparable harm and favorable balance of convenience for stay
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Arrest in U.S. due to own wrongdoing does not constitute irreparable harm; separation from fiancée insufficient for threshold

Crimes.Crime_Name: Conviction for burglary (equivalent to Canadian offence)
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Equivalence of foreign conviction to Canadian criminal offence
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether U.S. burglary conviction is equivalent to an offence under the Canadian Criminal Code
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Use of Black's Law Dictionary to determine legal equivalence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No error found in adjudicator's equivalence determination
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show error in equivalence or grounds for stay
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's argument that lack of counsel input was prejudicial
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Foreign convictions equivalent to Canadian offences may lead to deportation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged legal error in using dictionary without legal counsel input
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Guilty plea to California Penal Code offences, dictionary definitions
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Comparative analysis of U.S. misdemeanour and Canadian indictable offences
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Argued flawed methodology in determining equivalence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, statutory interpretation
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court

Crimes.Crime_Name: Conviction for theft (equivalent to Canadian offence)
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Equivalence of foreign conviction to Canadian criminal offence
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether U.S. theft conviction is equivalent to an offence under the Canadian Criminal Code
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Use of Black's Law Dictionary to assess legal equivalence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No error found in adjudicator's decision
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate legal error or irreparable harm
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant’s claim of unfair process due to lack of counsel during equivalence assessment
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Foreign convictions equivalent to Canadian crimes justify deportation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenged method of determining equivalence and right to respond
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Guilty pleas to California misdemeanours, adjudicator's interpretation
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Assessment of foreign offence alignment with Canadian Criminal Code
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Contested validity of using dictionary without legal representation
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Statutory records, legal reference materials
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Sponsorship appeal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was genuine or entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD found applicant's husband lacked credibility due to financial dependence and lack of effort to work in Mexico
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Primary motivation to remain in Canada
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal to IAD followed by judicial review

Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Sponsorship appeal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was not genuine and entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD found husband’s primary motivation was to remain in Canada, supported by financial dependence after return to Mexico
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Sponsorship refusal, IAD appeal, judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Disjunctive test of genuineness or intent under Regulation 4(1)

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Admissibility under immigration law
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer reasonably concluded the Applicant was a member of a terrorist organization
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of immigration officer's decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Initial admission at port of entry, corroborating evidence, inconsistent denials
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the Officer to establish reasonable grounds for belief
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Inconsistent statements by the Applicant affected credibility
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Membership requires more than casual involvement
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied to Officer's decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged membership in FMLN, a designated terrorist organization
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Denied membership after initially admitting it
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral statements, documentary consistency, behavioral credibility
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn inadmissibility finding
Crimes.Authority: Immigration Officer, Federal Court on judicial review

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Disclose Membership in Terrorist Group
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Involvement with a known terrorist organization (FMLN)
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Potential threat due to past association with terrorist group
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Based on prior admissions and activities linked to FMLN
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Undisclosed affiliation with a terrorist organization
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Prior admitted membership and activities with FMLN
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Applicant previously admitted membership, later denied
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Officer found prior admissions credible despite later denial
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Self-admissions, application inconsistencies
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to contradictions
Credibility_Factors: Lack of plausible explanation for change in story
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration admissibility based on non-disclosure
Crimes.Consequences_of_Action: Inadmissibility and refusal of permanent residence

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Alleged misrepresentation regarding terrorist organization membership
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer erred in concluding misrepresentation occurred
Crimes.Outcome: Permanent residence application refused due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed not credible due to conflicting statements
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior admissions vs. current denials
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credibility in denying prior membership
Crimes.Application_Error: Providing false or contradictory information in application
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of Officer's interpretation and conclusion
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found – Officer considered all relevant evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Truthfulness and consistency in application responses
Crimes.Authority: Immigration Officer, Federal Court on judicial review
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – issue centered on verbal/written misstatements, not forged documents

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of immigration decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in concluding the marriage was not genuine and ignored relevant evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer identified minor discrepancies in interview answers
Evidence_Type: Medical records naming applicant as next of kin
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) grounds based on marriage to a Canadian citizen
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Substantial documentary evidence supporting marriage genuineness
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider highly relevant documentary evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Medical records with designation as next of kin
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of review is reasonableness under administrative law
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marriage to a Canadian citizen after failed refugee claim
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision set aside; case remitted for redetermination by another officer

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of immigration decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in concluding the marriage was not genuine and ignored relevant evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer focused on minor interview inconsistencies while disregarding objective proof of relationship
Evidence_Type: Medical records naming applicant as next of kin
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Exemption from visa requirements on humanitarian and compassionate grounds due to marriage
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Existence of substantial documentary evidence confirming marital legitimacy
Crimes.Application_Error: Sole reliance on minor discrepancies without weighing contrary documentary evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Healthcare documents listing partner as emergency contact
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of review is reasonableness under administrative law
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marriage to a Canadian citizen following denial of refugee status
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision quashed; remanded for reassessment by a different immigration officer

Crimes.Application_Facts: Karim Bavi, a Convention refugee, overstayed his visa and was deemed a danger to the public due to criminal convictions.
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to overstaying and criminal activity
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of procedural fairness in deportation process
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Criminal record, letters of submission from Bavi
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide references within deadline
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Bavi's claims were not sufficiently supported due to lack of timely evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No violation of procedural fairness or Charter rights; decision based on criminal record and opportunity to submit evidence

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Deportation order challenge
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether deportation violates procedural fairness or Charter rights
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review and application for stay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Bavi submitted letters but failed to provide required references
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show irreparable harm and likelihood of success
Crimes.Legal_Rule: A Convention refugee can be deported if deemed a danger to the public
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness, Charter violations, risk of harm in Iran
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Criminal convictions for robbery and forcible confinement
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Minister relied on statutory authority and prior criminal conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Written submissions, criminal record

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Deportation based on danger to public
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of procedural fairness and Charter rights
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Deportation order issued by immigration authorities
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Assessed that Bavi posed a danger to public safety
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Canada exercised its right to deport based on public safety
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Public safety risk due to criminal history

Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of force, confinement of victim
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Letters of support submitted but not fully credible due to delay
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes, including robbery and forcible confinement
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Deemed a danger to the public
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Likelihood of reoffending due to past violent crimes
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: General public at risk due to offender’s history
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Criminal record, written submissions
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: High for convictions, low for unsupported claims
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Court found no reason to doubt criminal record
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – focus on immigration consequences

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative grievance involving military conduct and duty of care
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the CDS's decision on the CF's response was reasonable and justifiable
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review following internal grievance process
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: CF assessed ethical and technical risks to Cadets; no evidence of harm to applicant's reputation
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show unreasonableness of CDS decision
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's use of military rank linked actions to CF despite civilian status
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Standard of review is reasonableness; CF owes high duty of care akin to 'reasonable and prudent parent'
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged interference with academic freedom and reputational harm
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Unauthorized survey, SSRRB concerns, lack of approvals, ethical risks
Crimes.Defendant_Response: CF intervened to protect Cadets from potential harm
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and procedural records from internal review

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative grievance concerning data collection from minors
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether CF's response was reasonable under duty of care to Cadets
Crimes.Governing_Law: National Defence Act (NDA), common law duty of care
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review after CFGB and CDS decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Survey conducted without parental consent; no proof of actual privacy breach or reputational harm
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Use of military rank created perception of official endorsement
Crimes.Legal_Rule: CF owes high duty of care akin to 'reasonable and prudent parent'
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Ethical concerns over unauthorized data collection from Cadets
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of parental consent, unauthorized online survey, CF's duty to safeguard minors
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Internal military grievance system and judicial review
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Intervention to prevent potential privacy and ethical violations
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Internal correspondence, survey content, grievance records
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Implied duties under NDA and common law

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute over research authorization in military context
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether CDS’s decision was reasonable given Cadet protection obligations
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Final stage of judicial review after internal appeals
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicant ignored SSRRB feedback and proceeded without approval
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show decision was outside acceptable range
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant claimed academic freedom but failed to follow protocols
Crimes.Legal_Rule: CDS decisions are final unless unreasonable; high duty of care to Cadets
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation of unjustified interference with research activities
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: CF's actions justified to mitigate risk
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Unapproved survey, SSRRB objections, lack of ethical clearance
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Military governance and administrative law principles
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Action taken to enforce compliance and protect Cadets
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Official rejections, survey materials, grievance documentation
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Overturn CDS decision via judicial review

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Alleged implication of CF support for unauthorized activity
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether use of military rank constituted misrepresentation
Crimes.Governing_Law: Common law principles on representation; military regulations
Crimes.Outcome: No finding of formal fraud, but CF acted to correct perception
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant used rank which reasonably implied CF endorsement
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Survey publication with military affiliation, internal communications
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Military directives on use of rank and title
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk of perceived official backing for non-sanctioned research
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of military rank in civilian academic context
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disassociate personal research from military position
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None noted; court accepted CF’s risk-based rationale
Crimes.Application_Factor: Potential damage to CF reputation and Cadet welfare

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Commercial loan repayment dispute
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Band Council's decision to withhold loan payments is reviewable under judicial review principles
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: The impugned BCR relates to a commercial loan agreement, a private law matter
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish standing and amenability to judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not applicable – decision based on legal characterization
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Judicial review applies to federal boards, commissions, or tribunals exercising public law functions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of trust through withholding of loan payments
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim failed – matter deemed private contractual dispute
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of the loan agreement, BCR directing non-payment
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Public law vs. private law distinction
Crimes.Defendant_Response: BCR was internal and not subject to judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (loan agreement, BCR)
Crimes.Outcome: Application dismissed for lack of standing and non-amenability to judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Federal Courts Act, section on judicial review

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Loan repayment dispute involving alleged unlawful BCR
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Lawfulness and justiciability of Band Council Resolution to withhold payments
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant delayed filing without justification
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Timing of communication of BCR, nature of loan agreement
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Federal Courts Act – 30-day limitation period for judicial review
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged fraudulent or improper use of BCR to avoid repayment
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Timeliness of application and private law character of dispute
Crimes.Application_Error: Filed beyond 30-day limit without valid extension reason
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Judicial review standards for public law decisions
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Judicial review only available for public legal duties
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Dismissed due to untimeliness, lack of standing, and private nature of dispute
Crimes.Document_Fraud: No finding of document falsification; issue centered on interpretation and authority

Legal_Issue: Fairness and justification of negative credibility finding
Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for re-determination
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding based on late documents and religious knowledge
Legal_Provision: Section 101(1) IRPA - definition of Convention refugee
Evidence_Ignored: Explanations for late submission of documents
Decision_Outcome: Original decision invalidated due to unfairness

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of inadmissibility decision

Crimes.National_Security_Element: Association with NPFL, designated as a terrorist entity
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Threat posed by members of terrorist organizations
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Jalloh’s extensive involvement deemed a security risk
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Participation in violent raids and atrocities
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Medical evidence of PTSD considered but not determinative
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimonial, medical (PTSD diagnosis), documentary
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Duress claim rejected based on opportunity to escape
